docslist.DocsList.name: DocsList
docslist.DocsList.doc: DocsList The DocsList service contains methods to create and retrieve files and folders. The get*ForPaging methods allow retrieval of large sets by providing a Token to paginate with. // This example creates a file called 'example file' DocsList.createFile('example file', 'example file contents');

property.name: DEFAULT_RESULT_SIZE
property.doc: The default number of items returned in functions such as getAllFiles().

property.name: MAX_RESULT_SIZE
property.doc: The maximum number of items returned in functions such as getAllFilesForPaging(number).

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a file using the data stored in this blob.

argument.name: blob
argument.doc: the blob to create the file from

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a file with the given name and contents in the current folder.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new file

argument.name: contents
argument.doc: the contents of the new file

method.name: createFile
method.doc: Creates a file with the given name and contents in the current folder with the given MIME type.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new file

argument.name: contents
argument.doc: the new file contents

argument.name: mimeType
argument.doc: the mime-type of the new file

method.name: createFolder
method.doc: Creates a sub-folder with the given name in the current folder.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the name of the new folder

method.name: find
method.doc: Returns an array of all the files in the container that contain the given string.

argument.name: query
argument.doc: the search string

method.name: findForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number files maching the search query and a paging token.

argument.name: query
argument.doc: the search string

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of objects to return

method.name: findForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number files maching the search query, picking up from where the token from the previous lookup left off.

argument.name: query
argument.doc: the search string

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of objects to return

argument.name: token
argument.doc: the token from the previous lookup

method.name: getAllFiles
method.doc: Returns all the files in the user's drive (up to a maximum of DEFAULT_RESULT_SIZE).

method.name: getAllFilesForPaging
method.doc: Returns the first number files in drive (up to a maximum of MAX_RESULT_SIZE) and a paging token.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of files to return

method.name: getAllFilesForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number files in the user's drive, picking up from where the token from the previous lookup left off.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of files to return

argument.name: token
argument.doc: the paging token from a previous request

method.name: getAllFolders
method.doc: Returns all the folders in the user's drive (up to a maximum of DEFAULT_RESULT_SIZE).

method.name: getAllFoldersForPaging
method.doc: Returns the first number folders in drive and a paging token.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of folders to return

method.name: getAllFoldersForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number folders in the user's drive, picking up from where the token from the previous lookup left off.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of folders to return

argument.name: token
argument.doc: the token from a previous request

method.name: getFileById
method.doc: Gets the file with the given ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the file to be fetched

method.name: getFilesByType
method.doc: Returns all files of a given type.

argument.name: type
argument.doc: the type of files to get

method.name: getFilesByTypeForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number files of the given type in this container and a paging token.

argument.name: type
argument.doc: the type of files to get

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of files to get

method.name: getFilesByTypeForPaging
method.doc: Returns the next number files of the given type in this container, picking up from where the token from the previous lookup left off.

argument.name: type
argument.doc: the type of files to return

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the number of files to return

argument.name: token
argument.doc: the token from the previous lookup

method.name: getFolder
method.doc: Returns the folder at a given path.

argument.name: path
argument.doc: the path of the folder

method.name: getFolderById
method.doc: Gets the folder with the given ID.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the ID of the folder to be fetched

method.name: getRootFolder
method.doc: Returns the root folder.

docslist.File.name: File
docslist.File.doc: File This class contains methods to get information about the file and modify its contents. // This example logs the file type of the first file var file = DocsList.getAllFiles()[0]; Logger.log(file.getFileType());

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the File.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to add

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the File.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to add

method.name: addEditors
method.doc: Adds the given array of users to the list of editors for the File.

argument.name: emailAddresses
argument.doc: an array of email addresses of the users to add

method.name: addToFolder
method.doc: Adds the item to the given folder.

argument.name: parent
argument.doc: the folder to add the item to

method.name: addViewer
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of viewers for the File.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to add

method.name: addViewer
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of viewers for the File.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to add

method.name: addViewers
method.doc: Adds the given array of users to the list of viewers for the File.

argument.name: emailAddresses
argument.doc: an array of email addresses of the users to add

method.name: append
method.doc: Appends the given string to the existing contents of the file.

argument.name: contents
argument.doc: the string to append to the file

method.name: clear
method.doc: Clears all the contents of a document that is not of a Google Docs format.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getContentAsString
method.doc: Returns the contents of any file that isn't a Google document type as a string.

method.name: getDateCreated
method.doc: Gets the date that this item was created.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Returns the description of the item or null if a description doesn't exist.

method.name: getEditors
method.doc: Gets the list of editors for this File.

method.name: getFileType
method.doc: Returns the FileType of the file.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Returns the document ID associated with the item.

method.name: getLastUpdated
method.doc: Gets the date that this item was last updated.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Returns the name of the item.

method.name: getOwner
method.doc: Gets the owner of the item.

method.name: getParents
method.doc: Returns the parent folders.

method.name: getSize
method.doc: Returns the amount of disk space used by the item.

method.name: getThumbnail
method.doc: Returns the thumbnail image associated with this item, or null if no thumbnail exists.

method.name: getUrl
method.doc: Returns a URL to access the particular item.

method.name: getViewers
method.doc: Gets the list of viewers and commenters for this File.

method.name: isStarred
method.doc: Gets whether the item is starred.

method.name: isTrashed
method.doc: Checks whether the item is trashed.

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Makes a copy of the file with a default name (i.e.

method.name: makeCopy
method.doc: Returns a copy of the current file with the given name.

argument.name: newName
argument.doc: the name of the file copy

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the File.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to remove

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the File.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to remove

method.name: removeFromFolder
method.doc: Removes this object from the given folder.

argument.name: parent
argument.doc: the folder to remove the item from

method.name: removeViewer
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for the File.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: the email address of the user to remove

method.name: removeViewer
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of viewers and commenters for the File.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: a representation of the user to remove

method.name: rename
method.doc: Rename the item.

argument.name: newName
argument.doc: the new name of the item

method.name: replace
method.doc: Replaces the contents of the file with the contents provided.

argument.name: contents
argument.doc: the string with which to replace the file contents

method.name: setDescription
method.doc: Update's the item's description.

argument.name: description
argument.doc: the item's description

method.name: setStarred
method.doc: Sets the item's starred status in drive.

argument.name: starred
argument.doc: stars the item if true; unstars it if false

method.name: setTrashed
method.doc: Sets the trashed status of an item but does not permanently delete it.

argument.name: trash
argument.doc: trashes the item if true; untrashes it if false

docslist.FilesResult.name: FilesResult
docslist.FilesResult.doc: FilesResult Holds an array of files as well as a token used to enable pagination in methods that return a limited number of items such as DocsList.getAllFilesForPaging(number, token). // This example logs the names of all files in the user's drive in batches of 200. var pageSize = 200; var files = null; var token = null; // use a null token for the first lookup do { var result = DocsList.getAllFilesForPaging(pageSize, token); files = result.getFiles(); token = result.getToken(); for (var i = 0; i < files.length; i++) { Logger.log(files[i].getName()); } } while (files.length >= pageSize);

method.name: getFiles
method.doc: Gets the files contained in this result.

method.name: getToken
method.doc: Gets the token for this result.

docslist.Folder.name: Folder
docslist.Folder.doc: Folder A folder contains methods to create, find, and access files inside of itself. // This example gets a folder named 'kittens' and logs the files it contains. var folder = DocsList.getFolder('kittens'); var files = folder.getFiles(); for (var i in files) { Logger.log(files[i].getName()); }

docslist.FoldersResult.name: FoldersResult
docslist.FoldersResult.doc: FoldersResult Holds an array of folders as well as a token used to enable pagination in methods that return a limited number of items such as DocsList.getAllFoldersForPaging(number, token). // This example logs the names of all folders in the users drive in batches of 5 var pageSize = 5; var folders = null; var token = null; // using null token for the first lookup do { var result = DocsList.getAllFoldersForPaging(pageSize, token); folders = result.getFolders(); token = result.getToken(); for (var i = 0; i < folders.length; i++) { Logger.log(folders[i].getName()); } } while (folders.length >= pageSize);

method.name: getFolders
method.doc: Gets the folders contained in this result.

method.name: getToken
method.doc: Gets the token for this result.

docslist.Token.name: Token
docslist.Token.doc: Token A token object used to enable pagination in methods that return a limited number of items. For example, the token can be passed to sequential DocsList.getAllFilesForPaging(number, token) calls to continue paging through large sets of results. // This example logs the names of all files in the user's drive in batches of 200 var pageSize = 200; var files = null; var token = null; do { var result = DocsList.getAllFilesForPaging(pageSize, token); files = result.getFiles(); token = result.getToken(); for (var i = 0; i < files.length; i++) { Logger.log(files[i].getName()); } } while (files.length >= pageSize);

docslist.FileType.name: FileType
docslist.FileType.doc: FileType An enumeration used to represent various Google and non-Google file types.
